topic.title: SadMetadata - A searchable backup of most metadata from exhentai/sadpanda.

1564729846_1PBCaxayoEqvXFuayjxzGJvPub3BM.body:
> [barkbert](#comment_1_1HWJh6kB5X6jzoDhmnBpwXa9KPKEPtmGWf): Cool, but what does this even search? I don't seem to succeed with tags or artist names.


It currently only searches by 'metadataID' Which is just the latter part of the gallery url, so if: `https://exhentai.org/g/1330079/ea3aaac89f/` is your url then `/g/1330079/ea3aaac89f/` would be the 'metadataID' which is what you need to put into the search field (basically complete the url).

You can put in `/g/1330079/ea3aaac89f/` to test it. Make sure that you have actually loaded all of the database. You will not be able to find the metadata of galleries that are in a part of the database that you don't have.

For more 'complex' there isn't a graphical solution, yet. But you'd can to make your own SQLite query to find stuff. 
There are two tables `tags` and `metadata`
Examples:
Find metadata(excluding tags) by title: (replace `[YOUR_TITLE_HERE]`, `10` is the number of results you'll get at most):
`select * from metadata where lower(title) like lower('%[YOUR_TITLE_HERE]%') LIMIT 10`  
  
Find 'metdatdaID' by tag: (replace `[NAMESPACE]` and `[TAGNAME]`, `10` is the number of results you'll get at most):
`select MetadataID from tags where lower(namespace) is '[NAMESPACE]' and lower(name) is '[TAGNAME]' LIMIT 10`  
  
Find tags by 'metdatdaID': (replace `[METADATA_ID]`):
`select namespace||':'||name as tag, power from tags where MetadataID is '[METADATA_ID]'`
